snippet: Goaltender Martin Brodeur, who said he began pondering retirement two years ago, agreed to a two-year deal in July after his team’s run to the Stanley Cup finals.
abstract: New Jersey Devils goaltender Martin Brodeur, who abandoned his plans for retirement after team's Stanley Cup run in 2012, is eager to start his 20th season.
lead_paragraph: Goaltender Martin Brodeur, who said he began pondering retirement two years ago, agreed to a two-year deal in July after his team’s run to the Stanley Cup finals.

headline.seo: Martin Brodeur of Devils Eager to Lead Team Again
headline.main: 40-Year-Old Brodeur Eager to Start 20th Season With Devils
headline.print_headline: 40-Year-Old Brodeur Eager to Start 20th Season With Devils
